isis.stitle: VT 365 Diesel Engine - 2004 Model Year - POWER CYLINDERS - Cleaning and Inspection - Pistons

step1.para: Inspect pistons for scuffed or scored skirts, cracked or worn ring lands, and cracked or scuffed pin bores. Replace damaged pistons.
Check top compression ring groove for wear.

note.para: Top compression ring groove is a keystone design which requires measurement over gauge pins to determine ring groove wear.

step1.para: Install the piston gauge pins (0.082 in) in the top ring groove. Piston gauge pins must be parallel.
Use a 3 - 4 inch outside micrometer to measure diameter over piston gauge pins.
If measurement over the gauge pin is not within specifications , excessive piston groove wear exists. Replace piston.

figure.caption: Ring groove clearance check (intermediate ring shown)

step1.para: Check side clearance of intermediate ring groove as follows:

step2.para: Place outer edge of new ring in its respective ring groove.
Roll ring entirely around piston in its respective groove. Make sure ring is able to move freely in its groove.
Use a feeler gauge to check side clearance of each ring in its respective groove . Excessive side clearance indicates ring groove wear and requires piston replacement.

step1.para: Check side clearance of oil control ring groove as follows:

step2.para: Place outer edge of new ring in oil control ring groove.
Roll ring entirely around piston in its respective groove. Make sure ring moves freely in groove.
Use a feeler gauge to check side clearance of oil control ring in its respective groove. Excessive side clearance indicates ring groove wear and requires piston replacement.

step1.para: When considering piston replacement, check cylinder bore out-of-round specifications.

See Specifications in . Cylinder boring may be required. Bore reconditioning requires oversize service pistons. Verify piston size by measuring skirt diameter under conditions indicated in Specifications .

note.para: In addition to the standard size service piston, the following oversize pistons are available.

step1.para: If cylinder walls have minor surface damage, but are otherwise within specification (out of round), it may be possible to remove such damage by honing.
If cylinder bore is suitable for use without reconditioning, deglaze bore using a glaze breaker brush, then reassemble.
See for the correct deglazing procedure.

figure.caption: Piston skirt clearance check in cylinder bore

step1.para: Check piston skirt clearance in the cylinder bore. Correct as required.
